name: Golden Retriever
description: The Golden Retriever is gentle, affectionate, and eager to please. Famous for their friendly nature and trainability, Golden Retrievers are wonderful family companions and excel in therapy, service, and outdoor activities.

adaptability.description: Golden Retrievers adapt to most climates but prefer moderate weather. Protect from extreme heat and dry thoroughly after swimming to avoid skin issues.

diet.title: DIET
diet.mainDescription: Golden Retrievers thrive on a high-quality, balanced diet that supports joint health, energy, and coat condition. Choose protein-rich meals with healthy fats and essential nutrients.

tips.title: Include lean protein
tips.description: Golden Retrievers require 18–25% protein for strong muscles and energy. Chicken, fish, and lamb-based diets are great options.

tips.title: Support joint health
tips.description: Add glucosamine, chondroitin, and Omega-3 fatty acids to reduce inflammation and promote joint flexibility.

tips.title: Avoid excess treats
tips.description: Goldens have a tendency to gain weight easily. Use portion-controlled meals and low-calorie snacks.

tips.title: Age-appropriate meals
tips.description: Choose puppy, adult, or senior formulas according to age and activity levels.

training.title: GOLDEN RETRIEVER TRAINING
training.mainDescription: Golden Retrievers are intelligent, loyal, and eager to please. Positive reinforcement, daily exercise, and mental enrichment make training effective and fun.

tips.title: Regular exercise
tips.description: Provide at least 60 minutes of physical activity daily—fetch, swimming, and walking are excellent choices.

tips.title: Mental stimulation
tips.description: Incorporate scent games, puzzles, and basic commands to keep them sharp and well-behaved.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: Golden Retrievers have a thick double coat that requires consistent brushing and care to stay healthy and shiny.
grooming.mainDescription: Golden Retrievers have a dense, water-repellent coat. Regular brushing minimizes shedding and keeps their coat clean.

tips.title: Frequent brushing
tips.description: Brush 3–4 times a week using a slicker or de-shedding brush, especially during shedding seasons.

tips.title: Bath & ear care
tips.description: Bathe every 4–6 weeks using gentle shampoo and clean ears weekly to prevent infections.
